title: Type
description: This schema defines a type as an entity. Types includes property types and entity types. Custom types can also be defined by the users to extend the metadata system.

entityName.description: Name of the property or entity types. Note a property name must be unique for an entity. Property name must follow camelCase naming adopted by openMetadata - must start with lower case with no space, underscore, or dots.

category.description: Metadata category to which a type belongs to.

id.description: Unique identifier of the type instance.

name.description: Unique name that identifies the type.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this type.

nameSpace.description: Namespace or group to which this type belongs to. For example, some of the property types commonly used can come from `basic` namespace. Some of the entities such as `table`, `database`, etc. come from `data` namespace.

schema.description: JSON schema encoded as string that defines the type. This will be used to validate the type values.

customProperties.description: Custom properties added to extend the entity. Only available for entity type

updatedAt.description: Last update time corresponding to the new version of the entity in Unix epoch time milliseconds.

changeDescription.description: Change that lead to this version of the entity.
